message.content:
1)  Description of the Main Target Image

• Block Count and Layers  
  – In total there are 16 blocks.  
  – Viewed from the ground up, the tallest portion (the “tower” on the right) has five layers:
    1. Four orange cylinder “columns” on the ground.  
    2. Three yellow rectangular “planks” forming a platform.  
    3. A tall green rectangular block.  
    4. A blue cube.  
    5. A yellow half‐cylinder on top.  
  – On the left side, there are two layers:
    1. Three red arch‐shaped blocks side by side along the ground.  
    2. Three green cubes on top of the red arches.

• Spatial Relationships  
  – Left “Bench”:
    • Three red blocks form a row.  The first two are arches showing from the front; the third is an arch turned so that the curved opening is hidden from front view.  
    • Three green cubes sit directly atop those red blocks.  
  – Right “Table and Tower”:
    • Four orange cylinders stand in a square arrangement.  
    • Three yellow planks span across the tops of these orange cylinders, creating a flat deck.  
    • Centered on this deck is one tall green rectangular block, with a blue cube on top, and finally a yellow half‐cylinder capping the very top.

2)  Selecting the Required Blocks from the Dictionary

Needed block indices (with exact orientations as shown):  
• Red arches:  
  – #1 (twice) for the two arches showing from the front.  
  – #2 (once) for the arch turned sideways.  
• Green cubes (3×): #5  
• Tall green rectangular block (1×): #7  
• Blue cube (1×): #4  
• Orange cylinders (4×): #11  
• Yellow rectangular planks (3×): #9  
• Yellow half‐cylinder (1×): #13  

3)  Assembly Order

{  
  Step1:  Move block with index 1,  
  Step2:  Move block with index 1,  
  Step3:  Move block with index 2,  
  Step4:  Move block with index 5,  
  Step5:  Move block with index 5,  
  Step6:  Move block with index 5,  
  Step7:  Move block with index 11,  
  Step8:  Move block with index 11,  
  Step9:  Move block with index 11,  
  Step10: Move block with index 11,  
  Step11: Move block with index 9,  
  Step12: Move block with index 9,  
  Step13: Move block with index 9,  
  Step14: Move block with index 7,  
  Step15: Move block with index 4,  
  Step16: Move block with index 13  
}
